Button.TooltipReference: Toggle whether you want to destroy items without a confirmation window.
Toggle whether you want to spend AA points without a confirmation window.
Toggle whether you want to spend Adventure Points without a confirmation window.
Show help text when you left click on a target object or player.
Toggle whether you want tells to appear in their own separate chat windows.
Toggle whether you will let the game make you duck to fit into small spaces.
Toggle whether moving forward automatically makes your character stand up if sitting.
Toggle whether to autojoin general help chat channels.
Toggle whether to automatically give your group consent to move your corpse.
Toggle whether to automatically give your raid consent to move your corpse.
Toggle whether to automatically give your guild consent to move your corpse.
Toggle whether to automatically show the Rewards window when a reward is received and also when logging into the game. Rewards window will still show up if your pending rewards goes over the cap.

Button.Text: Open Tradeskill List with Ctrl Right Click
Button.TooltipReference: Open Tradeskill List with Ctrl Right Click.
Load a new look and style for your EverQuest UI.
Copy a window layout from any stored layout over the current layout.
If checked, you will automatically accept any kick requests made by another player logging into your account.
Click through yourself.
Click through pets.
Click through mercenaries.
Hide first window use alerts.
Toggle whether to automatically set the player AFK when inactive
Toggle whether to automatically set the player un-AFK when keyboard is active
Toggle whether your mercenaries will set their stance to Passive automatically the next time you are charged for mercenary upkeep and if you are AFK
Toggle whether newly acquired quests will be added to the task overlay.
When true, only steps that havent been completed will show in the task overlay.
When true, new tasks that are added will be placed at the top instead of the bottom of the list in the task overlay.
Toggle whether you want to loot all with a confirmation window.
Toggle whether you want to dismiss your mercenary with a confirmation window.
Toggle whether you want to receive a raid invite confirmation window.
Toggle whether you want to receive a confirmation window before entering Offline Mode.
Toggle whether you want to receive a confirmation window when selling a bag. Note that it will not prompt if you are selling the contents of a bag containing another bag.
Toggle whether you want to receive a confirmation window when selling the contents of a bag.
Toggle whether you want to receive a confirmation window when logging out and you are over the parcel limit.
Toggle whether you want to receive a confirmation window when saving over an existing spell set, hot button set, or extended target set.
Toggle whether the music that plays during character selection is randomized.
Toggle whether you want to auto-hide UI when initiating item placement.
Toggle whether you want your placement mode to default to cursor mode.
Toggles whether or not you want to display the real estate text overlay on item placement.
Toggles whether you want to turn off personal tribute when you log off for your next session.
Toggles whether you want to turn off trophy tribute when you log off for your next session.
Show/hide the names over other players.
Show/hide the names over NPCs.
Show/hide the names over pets.
Show/hide the names over mercenaries.
Show/hide pet owner names under pet name.
Show/hide mercenary owner names under mercenary name.
A colored ring appears around your current target's feet.
Determines whether the health % is displayed above a target.
Some models adjust their detail depending on their distance from you.
Toggle whether your helm is visible or not.
Toggle whether you see mounts for other pre-Luclin Player Characters.
Set the current window mode to be full screen.
Set the current window mode to be windowed.
Select your screen's resolution, color, and refresh rate settings.
Determines whether the buff timer is displayed on the buff.
Determines whether the buff counters are displayed on the buff.
Determines whether the buff limit uses are displayed on the buff.
Determines whether the song timer is displayed on the song.
Determines whether the song counters are displayed on the song.
Determines whether the song limit uses are displayed on the song.

Combobox.TooltipReference: Determines the visibility of new armor. If you select None, then no one will appear in new armor.

Label.TooltipReference: Adjusts the game's gamma in full-screen mode or the desktop's gamma if Windowed Gamma is enabled in advanced display options.

Slider.TooltipReference: Adjusts the game's gamma in full-screen mode or the desktop's gamma if Windowed Gamma is enabled in advanced display options.

Label.TooltipReference: Adjusts the game's gamma in full-screen mode or the desktop's gamma if Windowed Gamma is enabled in advanced display options.
